intro: Boehmeria spirei, commonly known as the narrowleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, and are typically clustered in inflorescences. Boehmeria spirei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
